page.title: 05Temple Newsam House (cont)
page.content: Other buildings are open and show what life on the farm used to be like. The Laundry room has a copper, a posser, a scrubbing board, a mangle and a flat iron. There is also a Stone Mason's shop, a Joiners shop and a Saw Mill. Leaflets and Checklists are ther for the children to test their skill in recognising the famr tools such as a seed broadcaster, a turnip drill, a stook mover and a flat harrow! The old methods and machines are used on the farm as far as possible, but olden times or now the animals still need 'mucking out'. After tracking down the implements, recognising the British White Cattle, the Anglo-Nubian goat, the Jacob sheep, Noah and Nellie the donkeys, walking through the gardens and round the lake, school parties or families can make for the picnic areas.
